item.title: David George from a16z on the future of going public at TechCrunch Disrupt 2025
item.dc:creator: TechCrunch Events
item.description: TechCrunch Disrupt 2025 is coming to Moscone West in San Francisco from October 27–29, bringing together 10,000+ startup and VC leaders to chart what’s next in tech. And on October 27, on the premiere industry stage: Going Public, David George of Andreessen Horowitz will take the mic for a fireside chat focused on one of […]

item.title: Mo Jomaa breaks down IPO prep for founders on the Scale Stage at TechCrunch All Stage
item.dc:creator: TechCrunch Events
item.description: An IPO may not be on your near-term roadmap, but the best founders start planning for it long before the bankers show up. At TechCrunch All Stage on July 15 at Boston’s SoWa Power Station, Mo Jomaa, partner at CapitalG (Alphabet’s independent growth fund), will lead a session titled “What to Think About Now If […]

item.title: US Senate removes controversial ‘AI moratorium’ from budget bill
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description: After going back and forth over the provision, Sen. Marsha Blackburn offered an amendment to strip the provision alongside Sen. Maria Cantwell.

item.title: Genesis AI launches with $105M seed funding from Eclipse, Khosla to build AI models for robots
item.dc:creator: Marina Temkin
item.description: Genesis AI, which aims to build a foundational model for powering all kinds of robots, has emerged from stealth with $105M in seed funding.

item.title: xAI raises $10B in debt and equity
item.dc:creator: Ram Iyer
item.description: Elon Musk's AI company, xAI, has raised $5 billion in debt and $5 billion in equity, Morgan Stanley said on Monday.

item.title: Cloudflare launches a marketplace that lets websites charge AI bots for scraping
item.dc:creator: Maxwell Zeff
item.description: Cloudflare is launching a new marketplace that reimagines the relationship between publishers and AI companies.

item.title: ChatGPT: Everything you need to know about the AI-powered chatbot
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers, Cody Corrall, Alyssa Stringer, Kate Park
item.description: ChatGPT, OpenAI’s text-generating AI chatbot, has taken the world by storm since its launch in November 2022. What started as a tool to supercharge productivity through writing essays and code with short text prompts has evolved into a behemoth with 300 million weekly active users. 2024 was a big year for OpenAI, from its partnership […]

item.title: Sri Mandir keeps investors hooked as digital devotion grows
item.dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh
item.description: Founded in November 2020, AppsForBharat introduced Sri Mandir shortly after to serve Hindu devotees with online prayers and the ability to make offerings virtually to Indian temples.

item.title: Legal software company Clio drops $1B on law data giant vLex
item.dc:creator: Marina Temkin
item.description: Clio, last valued at $3B, makes a bet on AI-powered legal data provider

item.title: Tesla sends driverless Model Y from factory to customer to promote its robotaxi tech
item.dc:creator: Sean O'Kane
item.description: The car traveled around 15 miles on highways, surface streets, and even a roundabout. But many questions remain about the stunt.

item.title: Next-gen procurement platform Levelpath nabs $55M
item.dc:creator: Marina Temkin
item.description: The investment signals confidence in Levelpath's fast growth and its potential to disrupt a market dominated by legacy players.

item.title: Fintech Bolt progresses its turnaround by landing Klarna as a partner
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description: Adding two big names as partners, Klarna and Palantir, is the kind of step that could help clean up Bolt’s reputation as it seeks to raise again.

item.title: Instagram now lets you share Spotify songs with sound to Stories
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: Instagram announced Monday it's finally adding the ability for users to listen to previews of songs they've shared from Spotify to Stories.

item.title: At TechCrunch All Stage: VC red flags, founder signals, and pre-seed traps — Charles Hudson will tell you what investors really see
item.dc:creator: TechCrunch Events
item.description: Charles Hudson of Precursor Ventures will join the TechCrunch All Stage lineup to share what investors really see in early-stage startups. Register now.

item.title: Apple reportedly considers letting Anthropic and OpenAI power Siri
item.dc:creator: Maxwell Zeff
item.description: While Siri can already call on ChatGPT for difficult questions, Apple now seems to be exploring a much deeper integration with technology from third-party AI providers.

item.title: Best iPad apps for unleashing and exploring your creativity
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: We’ve compiled a list of some of the best iPad apps for creativity that are available on the App Store.

item.title: Netflix teams up with NASA to boost its live TV offering
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description: Netflix and NASA announced a new partnership that will bring live space programming to the streaming service later this summer.

item.title: Songscription launches an AI-powered ‘Shazam for sheet music’
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description: This kind of product could be useful for a musician who records a song, then uploads it to get the sheet music -- that way, they can skip the step of having to manually transcribe their work.

item.title: From $5 to financial empowerment: Why Stash co-founder Brandon Krieg is a must-see at TechCrunch All Stage 2025
item.dc:creator: TechCrunch Events
item.description: Startup life is tough — funding rounds, team building, and managing finances can feel like trying to solve a Rubik’s Cube blindfolded. That’s exactly why TechCrunch All Stage 2025 exists: to give founders like you the tools, tactics, and real talk from those who’ve been through it and built something lasting. If there’s one session […]

item.title: US government takes down major North Korean ‘remote IT workers’ operation
item.dc:creator: Lorenzo Franceschi-Bicchierai
item.description: US prosecutors indicated a total of 13 people involved in the fraudulent scheme to steal and launder money for North Korea’s nuclear weapons program.
